caption: Food was great. I was surprised servers were in jeans and didnt know soup of the day.very clean
Great views. Only  reason  for the 5 .The main dish i would give a 0 do to over cooked .
GREAT EVERYTHING, A MUST TRY IN CHICAGO! BREATH-TAKING VIEWS, STELLAR SERVICE, MAGNIFICENT CUISINE. 5 STARS 🌟 ABSOLUTELY.
It's so tasty. Service is typically good. Food is like a place in Baltimore I liked.
I often meet people here to talk.
The bartender here is excellent.
Great place for meetings, small & large. Great views of the city.
Newly remodeled and always a fun time!
Enjoyable meal with good service, just be aware a membership is required.
We went on Valentine’s Day their 5 course meal. The food was good, but the service was terrible. We were also charged a “service charge” that was half the cost of our meal!
Amazing view, great cocktails, delicious food and good service.
Terrific people, and hostesses are great.
Beautiful views and pleasant staff.
Very nice place, good service and food
This is a very nice place, you need a membership or be a guest of a member
Great views of Chicago and the food is excellent! Service is also top rate
Always great food spectacular view and Rudy is the best waiter
Good food and great people... come on a clear day and enjoy an amazing experience.
Great Views!
Great view

Tonight wasn't the clubs fault. The female in the lobby was absolutley the worst person I have ever encountered. If you have seen the Shanique b"king video "you laugh  fort  the fumor.  This person made that humor a reality.  Never knew people so sad in thier life that work security /rescepetion that still have so much hatred and anger. Definetly will not return!
View is beautiful but getting in is a bit of a pain & the room was very hot!! Too hot for a small room with that many people in winter clothes.
A fantastic venue in menu, service and ambiance.  What a view!
Excellent place to do business and great tasting food. Excellent service and wine selection.
Very friendly staff, food was adequate, and the view was awesome.
A pleasant experience
Excellent place. High quality service.
Great food, service, and atmosphere
Great venue for hosting meetings & events
The most amazing club on Chicago.  The best views.  The best staff.  Everything is just amazing!
Delicious, great service, and amazing views
Incredible Craftsmanship formal dining.  Rudy was Magnificent Server.
Beautiful Venue, exceptional service for my Bride and Groom. Sally and her staff are simple amazing.

Buyer beware this restaurant charges a 20% service charge for absolutely nothing. They say it is because it is a private club but you have no way of knowing that until you are in the restaurant reading their menu. So between the service charge and the tip you are paying 40% of your total bill.  The food is average at best in my opinion and the craftsman dining room has an old vibe playing elevator music. I would not recommend it. There are so many better restaurants in Chicago  I am extremely disappointed in the amount we paid for the food. The value is not there.  I called the restaurant after we left because it really bothered me that we didn’t know about the 20% service charge until we saw the menu. The manager called me and was extremely rude. I rarely write reviews but I didn’t want other people to be taken advantage of as we were.
It was a wonderful experience.  Ambiance was lovely, the food spectacular. The workers Were all very kind and professional.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.
Difficult to get too but very vice.
Incredible food, great atmosphere and view :)
Nice ambience. Really good service. Food and drinks were delicious!

Had such a great time with a great friend. We've been there twice and plan to go back plenty more times. I hate the fireworks won't be back til next year😥. That Pink Line drink👏👏. The food amazing! The wait staff was the best part. The view wasn't shabby either 😍
Beautiful views of the city. They should have more window seats
Great Views Nice Space

My husband and I were so lucky to be able to have our wedding reception here. From the food to the view to the day-of coordination (shout out to Lorena!!), everything was picture perfect. We would recommend The Metropolitan whole-heartedly and without reservation. Thank you so much!
Seems like a nice place but for the price I paid for ticket I left early we couldn't really see anything and the buffet was like 4 items
Great place to catch dinner, a beautiful view of the city and the service is beyond incredible .
Awesome dinner was terrific and the view was spectacular the city.

My wife had grown up in Chicago and when we chose to get married in her hometown, we knew we wanted to make it a weekend full of iconic Chicago spots. Immediately, the Metropolitan Club came to mind as a place that would as unforgettable as it was beautiful. From the beginning, the team at the Metropolitan, namely Sally Woodson, made the entire process as seamless as ever. We had the lovely experience of allowing all of our guests to go up to the SkyDeck before the happy hour which really wowed everyone. From there, the food and the whole evening were absolutely perfect! Our guests still tell us about how much they enjoyed the night, which truly makes us so happy. If you are looking for an iconic Chicago venue for your wedding that you will remember for the rest of your life, look no further than the Metropolitan Club!
Was foggy so you couldn’t see out the window but a good place

Got a Groupon to try out food & hoping to get on skydeck, apparently only certain hours available for skydeck. Had a server who gave us an attitude & girls at front desk wasn't friendly. No hellos or byes.
It was an amazing place to dine! Shout out to Aylah for recommending this beautiful spot

The best place for the summer...views are AWESOME and I love seeing the summer fireworks here above the lake, the fountain show at Buckingham, and all the boats out on the lake. Well run and well managed and the people there are really great. I have no idea how they always remember my name and my favorite drink, but its always waiting for me when I sit down to eat.
Wonderful lunch!
Wonderful view from the 67th floor!

The Metropolitan used to be one of the premier restaurants in Chicago that I could count on to have a really nice high end meal with my vegetarian wife. Since the remodel and menu changes we will not be returning.  I took my wife here for her 50th Birthday and even advised the restaurant that we were coming in again for both her 50th and making sure they were aware of her dietary needs. This has never been an issue previously when dining here.  And to add insult to injury I advised them the next day of the issues via their website contact page.  I never heard back from anyone. They went from the absolute best dining room in Chicago to a place I'll never return to in a single experience.
Clean tables and friendly staff.
Beautiful and breathtaking

We had a TravelZoo deal here and when we came in, they seemed to steer us into a back dining room instead of the main room. There was practically nobody seated in the dining room, but service was still extremely slow. The server was polite, but not attentive. We asked for dessert menus, received them, and then waited for fifteen minutes for our server to reappear. The steak was good, but my chicken was raw. When I asked the server to take my plate away, there was no apology. I work in customer service. I understand the server was not to blame, but there still should be an apology on behalf of the restuarant. The couple at the table behind us got out and walked out because they waited to pay for so long and their server never came back. After I politely told our server my chicken was raw, she pretty much ignored us for the rest of the night. The entrees (that wasnt raw) were good, but not worth the price. The drinks we had were delicious. My husband's dessert had clearly just been taken out of the fridge and put in the microwave for a few seconds until the pastry had become hard. All in all not a good experience.
A tremendous evening was enjoyed by us, very good food, polite and friendly staff.
A great place to mingle, network, and grab a bite or drink. Very classy but comfortable.
I have been to a few weddings here this past year, always beautiful.

Beautiful venue for parties and weddings. Naturally the view is amazing! It appears that a nice bar is on the 67th floor as well but I suspect you can only partake with a membership, so if you are lucky enough to be invited by someone, GO!
Great reopening!
Amazing view ...
Awesome  views of the city!
It's a great place.

Great views, popular for wedding events. The newly remodeled space offers a mixture of old and contemporary vibe. The clientele is upscale, especially since yu need to be a member to hang out here. I had the pleasure of being invited by a member who also treated me to lunch (yay)! So... I decided to try Oysters Rockefeller, Calamari, Lobster Bisque, Chicken Vegetable Soup, Butternut Squash Ravioli, Chicken Pesto and the Scallops. I know thats a lot of food, LOL. My favorite out of everything we tried was the Chicken Pesto. It was simply delicious! The least favorite items was the Butternut Squash Ravioli. It was dry and not flavorful at all. This item I would recommend they take off the menu, actually. Everything else, was delicious and fresh. Tip: Ask for the complementary cookies at the end of yur meal.  I would absolutely recommend this place, I mean at least give it a shot. If not for the food, the atmosphere and people watching (yu never know who yu will run in to), is totally worth it. This is also a great place to "work from home".
Excellent service. Excellent food
Classy and amazing view

My wedding was here a couple of weeks ago. This place was amazing from beginning to end. My venue coordinator, Sally was so helpful and made everything go seamlessly. I would have my wedding here a thousand times over! My guests are still raving about the night. The beauty, the view, the food, and experience! Everything was lovely! Only thing I wish I could’ve done was have enough time for all my guests to go to the sky deck. We had that planned, but didn’t realize it would take an hour per table to go up there. So, we nixed it the day of. But, Sally ensured that we’d get a refund for that. If you want that aspect to be a part of your wedding, start earlier than 5 and plan accordingly. Anyway, very beautiful day. I wish I could relive it again :). Can’t wait to go back for our anniversary dinner! They offer you a complimentary anniversary dinner and replica wedding cake- so no need to save the top after your wedding!
Amazing place to eat, best food ever, Moises Montoya best person in the tower. Should get a raise.
Nice service and very good food
Lovely

Thoroughly enjoyed dinner Friday night. Recently remodeled club classy and comfortable. Views are spectacular. Food preparation and freshness is delicious. Memorable place. Staff are helpful and pleasant. Highly recommend

The view is incredible, the cost per plate for the food you get is lacking however. Around $150 a plate that would cost $20-30 at any regular restaurant. Come for the view but don't expect much out of the food.
This is a great club.
I wish I had taken photos!!!  What a view.   They just completed a huge renovation & didn’t miss a detail.  Thinking this would be the perfect place for my daughters wedding reception.
Cool digs. Cool view. Cool swill.
Beautiful cozy intimate setting with awesome food! Worth the money 😊
Amazing service, Amazing View of the city of Chicago!!  Gary and his staff went above and beyond to make sure our experience was the best it could be. We will be   coming back to visit soon.
Very nice place.  Food was great, steak was cooked to perfection, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting.  If we lived downtown we would definitely consider a membership here.

Excellent staff and views of downtown Chicago. Catalina the lead Membership director has always been extremely helpful with any of my needs and questions. The best part of the Metropolitan Club is the monthly "Beer Club" events. The place epitomizes fine dining and will appease any diner who is looking for food that matches the views. The 5pm free appetizers is the icing on the cake and it's always great to see what Chef will create.

I have attempted to schedule a venue tour for metropolitan club as a prospective for our wedding. The coordinator, Ashley isn't flexible or any bit accomodating. I then reached out for a second time thinking I would rearrange my schedule to fit theirs, but not even a response to acknowledge my message. I actually cannot imagine dealing with this venue come closer to your wedding date- i'd be SO stressed out working with people like this! I can rest easy because I have found 4 other venues that have gone above and beyond for my fiance and us. Stay away!!!

The view was fenomenal,  and the food was delisious; even though I got a discounted deal through Travelzoo, we spent about $190 dollars for a couple's dinner. This place is really overpriced, I'm not sure if we get back again.
It was very tasty and the view is amazing, but for the price and the hassle of getting up there, not quite worth it.
Food was good - sights were better. Recommend during restaurant week

Went here for a couple interviews. It's mostly a bunch of corporate folks without an office using it as a workspace. The have some small meeting rooms. I found it to be a glorified Starbucks that's not worth the price.  The views are nice to take in for a couple of minutes.
Beautiful venue for an event. The views are stunning and the food was delicious and well presented.

We had planned on getting married here. After signing the contract, Ashley did not once contact us to follow up. Finally 5 months from our wedding I had to call her and she finally sent me a time line on when and how to get things going - pick out linen, taste test food, reach out to the bakery to cake taste test and so on. We unfortunately had a terrible family incident and needed to reschedule the date. They keep your $5,000 deposit and then some depending on the date you were at in the contract. By the time we heard back on available dates from Ashley and manager Rick, we were already at the %50 timeline and would have to pay $11,000 unless we resigned a new contract right away then it would have been %40 ($9,000). Mind you, we spoke to them between November/December and they had several dates still open in 2017- March, April, May, August,October and November. So they wanted us to pay $9,000 then resign the contract and pay a new $5,000 deposit and start all over.  Even though they reiterated that they tried to work with us the best they could, I think its sad to charge your customer $11,000 even though you are going to still book with the venue. All we needed was a new date due to unfortunate circumstances, yet they still charge you a tremendous amount of money. Maybe when signing the contract they should let their customers know of this in advance. Whats even worse is that we paid the $11,000 and said we still planned on getting married here and we have not heard from Ashley or Rick once...... Took the money and could care less. Terrible-
Great place to talk, get work done, and eat some amazing food.
Love filming weddings here!

We visited the restaurant as part of a travelzoo deal.   We arrived as first guests for the night and we were seated facing Michigan Lake.   Most of the view was blocked by the tower roof and we asked for a different table.   The restaurant was completely empty and even after two requests,  we were not given permission from the manager to move to a different table.   I believe that they keep those tables for travelzoo customers only.   The food was good,  the waiter courteous and polite but for the price we payed and how the management treated us it was definitely not worth it.
Great views, decent food but who cares because the views are insane.
Was there for a biz meeting. Great food, great views from the 66th floor, and an accommodating staff.

Outstanding service for members -- the staff makes it a point to know everyone and provide personalized service, and the dues are far more reasonable than some private clubs with far fewer services.  A great place to hold a meeting, have a meal with a client or guest, sit down and work for a few hours, or to attend regular events -- the wine club membership, for instance, includes regular tastings and occasional opportunities to purchase at a fixed-percentage markup over wholesale.
Nice breakfast but where's Shannon Green
I love it.

You get a completely different feel from the club than you do at skydeck. At 67 floors up you're actually more in touch with the surrounding architecture instead of seeing rooftops and air conditioning units. The bar is top shelf. The lounge area is extremely relaxing. All in all an exceptional experience.

Picture you're sitting in the clouds overlooking the beautiful lights of downtown Chicago while sipping a nice glass of rose - this pretty much sums up what dining at the Metropolitan Club is like. The restaurant is located on the 67th floor of the Sears Tower (oops...even to this day I don't acknowledge the name change) and the views are breathtaking.  Normally, commoners like me aren't able to snag a table at this place because you need a membership to dine here, but as a part of a promotion, the impossible become possible. The interior of the space is dimly lit which really accentuates the views of downtown - great place to impress your special someone (with a membership of course, lol)  Our server Kyle did a great job answer all of our questions and point us in the right direction in terms of entrees. We ended up going with the:  BEEF CARPACCIO The thinly pounded layers of beef were seasoned great and went really well when paired with the thin toast like crackers that they were served with  LOBSTER BISQUE This was the star of the apps for sure. The soup had a strong and rich lobster flavor with large chunks of lobster throughout the soup. Like other restaurants I've been to, I entertained the thought of licking the bowl, but restrained myself.  SMOKED SALMON PENNE The pasta was cooked aldente and the alfredo type sauce had a wonderful smoked salmon flavor and came served with smoked mussels which were absolutely incredible.  GRILLED MAHI MAHI The mahi mahi was a lighter option which was served with nuggets of fried crayfish and a lovely Thai style salad with a tangy vinaigrette.  As for desserts, they brought out a sample of their cheesecake, bread pudding and chocolate pie. I must say the bread pudding was the standout - it was warm gooey and so satisfying after wrapping up our meal. Kyle did a great job checking in on us without being overbearing. Of course the best thing of the night was our spectacular view of the city from our seats. I might actually consider getting a membership here after my experience!

This is a club you have to be a member to eat at, but you can eat there without being a member during Chicago's Restaurant Week.  Just went there for the first time this past Restaurant Week and the food was amazing!  Definitely would go back again.
